title: Whats the point in playing a game if you can't play what you want to play?
body:
If you don't play a tier 1 champ you are severely cucking your chances of climbing. its so fucking lame.

I miss the days where there were like 3 super op champs with 55% winrates and then a bunch of alright ones.

Now its like there are 15 completely op champs that an ape could pub stomp on and if you don't get them on your team you may as well just FF at 15.

replies.body:
I play the champions who I enjoy...if they happen to be OP in the current patch, great! If they aren't I'll play them either way. In low elo it isn't about hopping on the "meta train" it's about knowing your champion and their strengths and weaknesses.
Sure, Urgot might be the newest flavor of the month for top (for example...I dunno if he's even that strong anymore) but if you have never played him before and vs a Maokai with 300+ games with Mao, chances are the Mao will win due to knowledge.

Super OP champs only mean so much
https://i.imgur.com/0mKXcg1.gif

> [{quoted}](name=Riot MapleNectar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2018-09-24T16:45:47.763+0000)
>
> https://i.imgur.com/0mKXcg1.gif

Ok so since you applaud his courage for playing weak champions vs OP champions and it not mattering because of skill level difference, what happens when you are about the same? It's still OK for a champion to be broken then even though you both have the same knowledge of the game, you will say with certainty that it's OK for Irelia to be unbalanced simply because the other play may have more experience on a worse champion? I like playing my favorite champions as much as the next guy, but if its a decision between trying to have fun and winning then of course I won't pick some trash champion even if i like them in RANKED. Arguments should be based around this and not some fairytale blind pick where you do whatever off-meta for fun.

If you both have the same knowledge of the game, then you'll know the champion will be slightly stronger and can ask for ganks and can sit back/play passively until you can get help from your jungler or mid laner. You don't always have to be able to 1v1 someone. Even if that "OP Champ" is strong, if put behind, he will no longer be "OP". Ask for camps. Tell the jungler when he has no flash

No where am I talking about off meta... taking Janna jungle or something like that. I'm talking viable picks here. Off meta is something completely different.

> [{quoted}](name=Namîste,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0001000200000000,timestamp=2018-09-24T19:17:06.738+0000)
>
> If you both have the same knowledge of the game, then you'll know the champion will be slightly stronger and can ask for ganks and can sit back/play passively until you can get help from your jungler or mid laner. You don't always have to be able to 1v1 someone. Even if that "OP Champ" is strong, if put behind, he will no longer be "OP". Ask for camps. Tell the jungler when he has no flash
> 
> No where am I talking about off meta... taking Janna jungle or something like that. I'm talking viable picks here. Off meta is something completely different.

Jesus are you guys delusional about balance or just not understanding me? It is UNFAIR for a champion to be broken like the state that Irelia, Jhin, or Akali are in. You can play well against that champion and beat them, it doesn't change the fact that they are unbalanced. You want to talk strategy on beating an overpowered champion? How about the champion not be that way in the first place? There is a ton of unbalance right now with a combination of the rune system, items, and some champions.

I don't think that was what they were saying.
They never said unbalanced champions are fair.
All they said was that any champion can be played despite the meta.
The game is balanced enough for this to work
It's very difficult to balance 140+ champions

> [{quoted}](name=DaBooosh,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=000100020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-24T20:45:10.215+0000)
>
> I don't think that was what they were saying.
> They never said unbalanced champions are fair.
> All they said was that any champion can be played despite the meta.
> The game is balanced enough for this to work
> It's very difficult to balance 140+ champions

Thats common sense thats not even an argument, of course you can play whatever champion you want. You'll just be at a disadvantage depending on what it is from the balance team.

> [{quoted}](name=Namîste,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0001000200000000,timestamp=2018-09-24T19:17:06.738+0000)
>
> If you both have the same knowledge of the game, then you'll know the champion will be slightly stronger and can ask for ganks and can sit back/play passively until you can get help from your jungler or mid laner. You don't always have to be able to 1v1 someone. Even if that "OP Champ" is strong, if put behind, he will no longer be "OP". Ask for camps. Tell the jungler when he has no flash
> 
> No where am I talking about off meta... taking Janna jungle or something like that. I'm talking viable picks here. Off meta is something completely different.

Gank Irelia, Hahaha.....
Invade Graves? ROFLLLLLLL this is too funny.
Kill Jhin? Stop man, you are killing me.
Win a teamfight against Kaisa? Lmao

See? that's exactly my point, you can't even if the player doesn't have a very good knowledge about the match up, if he has decent mechanics he will most likely be able to get a lead.
Let alone if that person knew the match up,  then it is pretty much GG if your team doesn't have any broken champions. 

and the higher your Elo is, the harder it becomes. Since in D+ the match ups and champion knowledge is pretty common, so the only advantage you have is that you played your champion more. Meanwhile their champ can just build up leads and get other advantages on the map because your champ isn't broken.

There is a guy who got challenger by playing Kayle and Jax only. There are people who one trick weak champions and have gotten high elo.

Edit: Annie Bot has 3007 games on Annie with a 51% w/r in Masters!
not disagreeing... but JAx is top tier atm.
This was a while back. He made a reddit post a long time ago. I don't remember how Jax was at that time.

> [{quoted}](name=10 fps,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0001000200000001,timestamp=2018-09-24T22:19:10.377+0000)
>
> There is a guy who got challenger by playing Kayle and Jax only. There are people who one trick weak champions and have gotten high elo.
> 
> Edit: Annie Bot has 3007 games on Annie with a 51% w/r in Masters!

Those are some pretty big strawman arguments you got there buddy. I never said you can't win with any champion you choose, you are just at an immediate disadvantage because of balancing.
You wait few patch then role are reverted ¯\_ツ_/¯

Or you can be a 1000-game Zyra main and lose lane to a first-time silver Talon because your plants bug out and don't attack, not that it matters because Talon kills them all *by accident* with a W.

Huge return on investment there. Every game it's like laning against the enemy champ and Riot in a 2v1.

> [{quoted}](name=Vekkna,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=000100020002,timestamp=2018-09-24T19:24:28.687+0000)

QFT

I agree with you completely. If you have sufficient game knowledge then you can play practically anything.

> [{quoted}](name=Namîste,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-09-24T04:21:00.095+0000)

>

Not really pick a rengar or khazix and result will be the same low or higher elo, these champs are point to click and mechanically taking no skill to play at all.
Both Rengar and Kha Zix are hard to use champs.

> [{quoted}](name=saltran,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2018-09-24T07:12:46.484+0000)
>
> Both Rengar and Kha Zix are hard to use champs.

Good joke hard to use champs, If I am unlucky and didn't warded that bush, only 1 jump melts 50% of my HP, without any counter play to fight back the Rengar. I have no idea why they reverted his mini rework.

Tbh fought yday a rengar, he legitimately deleted my adc in 0.5 sec before I even seen him. So my advice stop being salty delusional player and do some research.

>Tbh fought yday a rengar, he legitimately deleted my adc in 0.5 sec before I even seen him. So my advice stop being salty delusional player and do some research.

I main adc, I'm the one that gets deleted in even less than 0.5 when an assasin is feed caughts me.

Do I cry about them? No, because I know that the counterplay to those assasins is called peel and teamplay specially with the supp or dont get caught alone as a fking adc.

> [{quoted}](name=saltran,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=00010001000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-24T12:05:35.871+0000)
>
> I main adc, I'm the one that gets deleted in even less than 0.5 when an assasin is feed caughts me.
> 
> Do I cry about them? No, because I know that the counterplay to those assasins is called peel and teamplay specially with the supp or dont get caught alone as a fking adc.

Lol thats the point because I couldn't even peel, I cant see him, once I saw him my adc was already dead. 1 AA 1 Q in 0.5 sec, how I suppose to peel against that instant jump burst.

Then the assasin was already feed or the adc was out of position.

Blame who feeded the assasin first or blame the adc that plays too risky.

> [{quoted}](name=Namîste,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-09-24T04:21:00.095+0000)
>
> I play the champions who I enjoy...if they happen to be OP in the current patch, great! If they aren't I'll play them either way. In low elo it isn't about hopping on the "meta train" it's about knowing your champion and their strengths and weaknesses.
> Sure, Urgot might be the newest flavor of the month for top (for example...I dunno if he's even that strong anymore) but if you have never played him before and vs a Maokai with 300+ games with Mao, chances are the Mao will win due to knowledge.
> 
> Super OP champs only mean so much

What do i do though when i die in 0,6 seconds? My skills are irrelevant if i die before i even know someone is after me :(

Just last game i was on Ashe, my second most played with a lot of games on her in total.

Enemy had a toplane thresh running dark harvest, stormrazor, trinity force and duskblade........i could not go anywhere near him without just instantly dying from a single hit, if he flashed or used Q on something nearby to gapclose i had no way to escape short of ulting and praying he wouldnt catch up.

But 2 times he did, and i died literally instantly both times, 0,9 seconds and 0,6 seconds.

Do tell me, what does skill matter when you die in such a short timespan with almost no warning?

And look at the recent Zoe montage Riot released,......people just dropping left and right dying from full health being unable to even respond, is this really healthy?

I like playing Ashe, i like her ulti and her E and the idea of a utility marksman that has the ability to ramp up damage in a extended fight.

But what does my fancy matter when my opponent can literally delete me before i can even finish my W animation?

Now of course in this case thresh was fed,,,,,,,,but even if he was less fed i´d just die in 2 autos or maybe 3 even if he wasnt, and once he got dark harvest stacked i´d die regardless of him being fed or not. 

Meanwhile i myself would need .....6-8 or so, just to kill a target who has bought no extra armor or significant amount of health. 

You sir, truly think that skill matters that much anymore?  I am in doubt :(

> [{quoted}](name=Thefrostyviking,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=00010003,timestamp=2018-09-24T19:57:43.842+0000)

> 
> You sir, truly think that skill matters that much anymore?  I am in doubt :(

While toplane thresh is something that would only work on blind pick or really low elo, ur point is still correct that burst damage is way too high this season.
Are you talking about the game that you won and also only died 3 times in?

> [{quoted}](name=10 fps,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=000100030001,timestamp=2018-09-24T22:24:56.132+0000)
>
> Are you talking about the game that you won and also only died 3 times in?

Yep.

I was playing passively all game because i couldnt go near anything since alistar kept flashing to knockup me and the other two times i relaxed a bit i suddenly got jumped by thresh who 1hit my face......only survived those because the morg kept diverting their attention mid-fights which let me run out. 

Well thankfully we ended up being pretty good at securing jungle ganks and midlane roams so we won lane in terms of kills,assist and towers in the end but teamfighting was tough, really tough. 

Well the saving grace was that the enemy team liked to scatter around way too much so my ults ended securing kills for fizz and eve which eventually won us the game more or less by means of us forcing constant 4v5´s or even 3v5´s.

But it was by luck far more than any kind of skill.....had they actually grouped i´d be completely helpless x)

They only mean so much in silver elo where half of the players are new to the game and don't know what baron is, and the other half are either hardstuck silver for 3 seasons or new accounts for smurf to do unranked to master or this kind of stuff .

Your argument is void when players start to understand the game and the dynamics and actually turn their monitor on around plat 2 +  ..

A lesser player will win against a better player at higher elo because the mechanics matter less than the braindead kits of champions like Irelia / akali / graves / jax / tryndamere and so on .

Up until really high elo, how good you are at a champion matters way more than "playing op champions". You can play whatever you want, nobody is stopping you. Stop making excuses as to why you aren't climbing and actually improve at the game... or you can keep blaming your loses on everything except for your gameplay
Not exactly. Riot's attempts to buff champions into pro-play ends up creating low elo stomps by champions that are just too forgiving to use. {{champion:238}} {{champion:157}}

{{champion:38}} Then explain to me how I can pick this fuck who I've played like 10 times at most and absolutely decimate and then when I pick
{{champion:55}} , a champ who I've been playing for almost 8 years I don't win nearly as easily?

Like my Kass is legit just braindead and I'll still hard stomp cause it's Kass and Kass is beyond broken atm. So, you mean to tell me that playing OP champs doesn't matter? Good meme.
Simple: You've been playing katarina for 8 years but you're still awful with her.

Someone doesn't remember the time {{champion:38}} was so broken that people will legit first time him in rank games to prevent the enemy team from getting him and still win?

Also Kat is garbage, if she stomps someone it's because of that players stupidity not the one piloting the champ.
Yeah, you speak the truth, season 3 Kass was even more braindead and current Kat's kit is based around the other players' stupidity. Someone knows how the game works :)

Hmm something tells me that's not true, but I suppose you won't listen due to this silly little fallacy of yours. I'm not the best Kat by any means but I will say that I'm quite good since she's my favourite champion.

Again, don't try to deny that Kassadin is straight overpowered and right now and if you pick him you probably will win.

Some of it could depend on your personal style and experience with other, somewhat similar champs. Kassa has an early game that just plain sucks, it's rrally easy to push him out of  farm and interaction with ranged attacks.

Fleet Footwork, Dark Seal and Corrupting. Good luck pushing him off of farm in the early game. Also Taste of Blood and Ravenous. He has sustain out the backside. But then that shows that the new runes are honestly broken since they can cater one way for a champion that much, and that Fleet is still broken (it should lose its AD and AP scaling and be a flat amount imo).
Fleet is pretty strong. Beats out the whole conditional movement sorcery tree imo, but who takes it for the scaling?
Trust me, it heals for a lot.
I'm already sold. ADC bias, and no viable options on the gated movement speed tree.

> [{quoted}](name=ZephyrDrake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-09-24T04:29:04.472+0000)
>
> Up until really high elo, how good you are at a champion matters way more than "playing op champions". You can play whatever you want, nobody is stopping you. Stop making excuses as to why you aren't climbing and actually improve at the game... or you can keep blaming your loses on everything except for your gameplay

exactly this. Every high elo player will tell you that you can play whatever the fuck you want as long as you're consistent with it to climb. Learn a few champs and stick with them and you'll climb as long as you try to improve and stop blaming the champion for your losses.
How about you play those "completely op champs" and prove your point then

> [{quoted}](name=SugeMinPikk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-24T04:19:25.164+0000)
>
> How about you play those "completely op champs" and prove your point then

Can't now.

> [{quoted}](name=SugeMinPikk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-24T04:19:25.164+0000)
>
> How about you play those "completely op champs" and prove your point then

People forgot how unbalanced Irelia was, though huh, TFBlade peaked rank 1 with her. c:
And when they ban his key champions he can't carry.
WHAT A COINCIDENCE AM I RIGHT?

Except TF Blade has been on and off rank 1 for the past like 2.5 years. He hasn't dropped from 1200+ LP challenger in months and rank 2 (if it isnt ALSO him) has consistently been 200 LP behind. Also TF Blade has 4 champions in his top played he can 1v9 on. You cant ban them all which is why he is consistently rank 1.

> [{quoted}](name=My Waifu Vanilla,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EGyBxTOG,comment-id=000000020001,timestamp=2018-09-24T15:34:04.553+0000)
>
> Except TF Blade has been on and off rank 1 for the past like 2.5 years. He hasn't dropped from 1200+ LP challenger in months and rank 2 (if it isnt ALSO him) has consistently been 200 LP behind. Also TF Blade has 4 champions in his top played he can 1v9 on. You cant ban them all which is why he is consistently rank 1.

Do you know what Ghosting is?
TFBlade streams.
I have seen a clip of him reacting to all of his 5 champions getting banned.
As soon as he loses Irelia, his "divine and majestic" power to carry plummets.

But that isn't the case.  Like do you even look at his stats? Akali, Irelia, Jax, and Camille all hover the 60% winrate mark in top challenger across his rank 1 and rank 2 accounts. If you ban everything of his then congratulations on letting the mid laner get any champion they want. Or the jungler. Or basically anyone else. Even when TF Blade picks shit like Ornn he doesn't run it down.

I mostly hate how every lane has its CLEARLY overtuned/busted champs that are better than like 80% of the champs they face in that lane

TOP/MID: {{champion:164}} {{champion:39}}{{champion:157}}  {{champion:8}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:38}}   These champs are basically 1v3 champs who are very easily worth two champions into the mid to late game and can single-handedly swing every fight and skirmish. Its EXTREMELY hard to lose a game if you have them on your team and manage to get them to mid/late at which point they will steamroll through the enemy team one by one. These are basically the DOTA equivalents of hard-rice carries like Anti-Mage,Spectre,Terrorblade PA ect. If you get them to late there is a 90% chance you auto-win UNLESS the enemy team has somebody else on this list to match them. Otherwise the power difference between teams is too massive.

BOTTOM: {{champion:145}} This is not a champion. This is... an abomination.
 {{champion:51}} hard wins lane and hard wins game. 

SUPP: {{champion:555}} why play any other Hook support? both Blitz and Thresh have basically been retired by this guy. {{champion:12}}  still one of the best damn tank supports in the game. does decent damage, has great CC and initiation power. realisticallythe tankiest support in the game.

JUNGLE: {{champion:104}}  another 1v3 champ completely immune to the gaze of the balance team for some reason. I guess they feel like whatever champ would fill the void next would be more oppressive or something but eh? (like kha'zix)
{{champion:11}}  We all know what he is capable of. If you let him finish Rageblade and dont have the CC to lock him down its over. experiences with this champ highly varies on elo but rest assured he is built to hyper-carry.

SPECIAL SHOUTOUTS:

{{champion:84}} <-- dumpsters basically every single melee match up with Q spam and stealth. AUTOWINS all other lane matchups 9/10 times by simply hitting 6 because Execute damage is ridiculous on top of Ignite/Electro nonsense + 3 gap closers

{{champion:7}}  <-- wont really "carry" you a game per-say but is more or less a more straight forward X2 more effective braindead version of Ahri. Why pick any other AP assassin mid?

{{champion:86}} also dumpsters a lot of top match ups. Even if you beat him he still wins because of Villain system. so much stats has been dumped into him playing with a brain is completely optional. Incredibly unfun to play against and feels 50/50 even into what used to be his WORSE hard counter matchups like {{champion:114}} or {{champion:122}}. fuck statsticks. Garen has evolved into a stat sledgehammer.
How can ppl still cry about Caitlyn when she's bad on soloQ and ignored on pro play.

Cuz those bitchass traps are still under my damn turret and it's annoying as fuck.

Cait op? Hell no this dude's on crack. But is she annoying? Yes.

Because clearly you only care about her numbers and not her actual design.
Having a champ built to win lane AND win game is a cardinal sin of the highest degree imo when it comes to champion design.

Champs who get to be a bully early should not ALSO hyperscale into the late game.
whatever happened to giving the lategame monsters purposefully weak early games? any one remember Vayne the zero waveclear lane losing machine? or  how gutter trash Nasus/Pre-Rework poppy used to be to offset their late god mode?

Riot threw that design principal out the window. half the hyper scalers in the game now ALSO have perfectly reasonable or fine early game to boot

{{champion:51}} {{champion:157}} are both literally lane bullies. Hyper scaling....lane bullies
{{champion:8}}  generally has zero problems surviving the lane due to his sustain.  unless he is into certain matchups he wont have much kill pressure until sorc boots+oblivion orb /rank 5 Q but thats fine.
{{champion:39}}  is NOt weak early. can very easily all-in you over and over again when she goes a on Q rampage and Conq is primed. if you ever get hit by ONE of her E's its over for you
{{champion:114}}  another champ who is NOT WEAK early. against most matchups she can just vital spam for free trades
{{champion:41}}  Pantheon v2 lane bully. but unlike panth hyper scales.
{{champion:18}}  beats most other marksmen in a early all-in. AND will outscale them.

the powercreep is LoL has gotten so bad there is no longer any rhyme or reason to champion designs. Weakness and strengths are just picked at random and have nothing to do with one another anymore. Kai'Sa is probably one of the strongest ADC's at the moment but what is her weakness? her Q gives her amazing waveclear, she's fine into tanks, she can actually duel assassins mid-late. Its just annoying and dumb how every new champ riot releases is blatantly just 20% stronger than a normal champion but with half the weaknesses.
